Job Title: Sr Photo Studio Producer

Location: San Antonio, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
As a global marketing experience company, Quad’s goal is to help our clients win every day. We use our data-driven integrated marketing and manufacturing platform to streamline solutions for our clients, reduce friction and enhance their marketing spend effectiveness. We’ve built a rich legacy by believing in our people, allowing them to act like owners and to take charge of their own success. Whether an operator, sales rep, a graphic artist or a clinician, we’re all driven to perform at our best— for ourselves and our clients. At our core, we’re a company that believes we can always create a better way.

The primary role of the Senior Producer is initial and ongoing client engagement, management of photo group production: this includes scheduling, client relations, booking of crews, talent and locations and maintaining studio budget. The Sr. Producer will collaborate with the client and studio team for schedules and timing.

Responsibilities

The Sr. Producer is expected to fulfill the following duties:

Complete understanding of photographic, video, CGI, and imaging processes Build and maintain client relationships with low-level, mid-level and even senior-level management. Develop long-term client partnerships that results in a mutually beneficial, growth-oriented business and working relationship. Manage multiple project timelines and budgets simultaneously Manage studio teamResearch and maintain vendor relationships. Create project-based estimatesDevelop and maintain production timelines and ensure accurate completion of productionCommunicate with client and vendors during all stages of project(s)Serve as liaison between client, production and other departmentsRepresent department in associated meetings.Responsible for ensuring that adequate levels of content production are maintained, and such production is of a high standard of quality.Manage production budgets, timelines, and logistics:Request and analyze bids from external vendors for content productionDevelop client-facing estimates for content productionOversee the procurement and return/donation of product(s) for shootingTalent castingDevelop production books, matrices, and shot listsMaintain original signed copies of photographic and audio/visual releasesManage post-production processes to ensure accurate completion of project Interact with vendors to ensure timely completion and invoicing of projectsMaintain complete production files for historical reference, including legal releases and negotiated usage rights Perform administrative duties, such as preparing reports, processing of vendor invoices, and reconciling jobs for final invoicingEncourage and motivate team performance, generate, and sustain the enthusiasm and commitment of staff and develop a positive environmentDevelop and refine process to increase efficiency and productivity without decrease in quality
Qualifications

Appropriate education and/or experience may be substituted on an equivalent basis

4-year Degree in Photography, Media, Design, Visual Arts, Fine Arts, Business Management, or equivalent work experience10 or more years of experience in producing in a high-end, high-volume photography studio for retail advertising within an agency environmentExperience managing a creative agency and/or photography studio teamsBroad understanding of CGIUnderstand licensing agreements for imageryMust possess excellent problem-solving skills.Knowledge of photography workflows and scheduling, production budgets, estimating and financial reporting and product/merchandise management systems and data/recordsProficiency with Apple/Macintosh computer platforms and related softwareProficiency with Microsoft Office software – specifically Outlook, Word, Excel & PowerPointDemonstrate the ability to handle many issues, items, and functions at one time and deal rapidly with multiple items in prioritized sequence.Demonstrated knowledge of current technologies utilized in the broadcast and photography realms 

We offer excellent benefits to eligible employees, including 401(k), holidays, vacations and more.

Quad is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We are committed to creating a place of belonging — a space where employees do not need to sacrifice who they are to exist and grow in our workplace. Quad does not discriminate on any unlawful basis including race, religion, color, national origin, disability, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Quad also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories.

Drug-Free Workplace

Experience Level (if available): Associate
